newsroom.api package

Submodules

newsroom.api.permissions module

Custom permission classes for the Newsroom API.

This module defines role-based and action-based permission classes for use with Django REST Framework viewsets and views.

Helpers

The helper functions (_is_auth, _is_admin, etc.) wrap role checks on the custom User model, handling missing methods gracefully.

class newsroom.api.permissions.CanApprove(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: BasePermission

Allow users who can approve (custom model perm) or Editors/admins.

Notes

The Article model defines:

Meta.permissions = [("can_approve", "Can approve articles")]
Parameters:

  • args (Any)

  • kwargs (Any)

Return type:

Any

has_permission(request, view)[source]

Check if user is allowed to approve articles.

class newsroom.api.permissions.IsAuthorOrEditor(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: BasePermission

SAFE methods are allowed. For write methods: allow if the user is the object’s author, an Editor, or staff/superuser.

Parameters:

  • args (Any)

  • kwargs (Any)

Return type:

Any

has_object_permission(request, view, obj)[source]

Check if user is author, Editor, or admin for unsafe methods.

Parameters:

obj (Model) – The object being accessed.

Returns:

True if permission is granted, else False.

Return type:

bool

newsroom.api.serializers module

Serializers for the Newsroom API.

This module defines serializers for:

  • Publisher

  • Article

They transform model instances into JSON representations and handle validation for incoming data.

class newsroom.api.serializers.ArticleSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for Article.

Includes nested publisher representation (read-only), related author string, and an extra publisher_id field for write operations.

Fields

idint

Primary key of the article.

titlestr

Title of the article.

bodystr

Main content of the article.

cover_urlstr

Optional cover image URL.

statusstr

Workflow status (Draft, Pending, Approved, Rejected).

publisherPublisherSerializer

Nested publisher representation (read-only).

publisher_idint

Primary key of the publisher (write-only).

authorstr

String representation of the author (read-only).

author_usernamestr

Username of the author (read-only).

created_atdatetime

Timestamp of creation (read-only).

updated_atdatetime

Timestamp of last update (read-only).

approved_atdatetime

Timestamp of approval (read-only).

Bases: object

newsroom.api.urls module

URL configuration for the Newsroom API.

This module registers API routes for:

  • ArticleViewSet

  • PublisherViewSet

It also includes authentication endpoints for the Django REST Framework browsable API.

newsroom.api.urls.router

Default router for automatically generating RESTful routes.

newsroom.api.urls.urlpatterns = [<URLResolver rest_framework.routers.DefaultRouter.urls (rest_framework.routers.DefaultRouter.urls.app_name:rest_framework.routers.DefaultRouter.urls.app_name) ''>, <URLResolver rest_framework.urls (rest_framework.urls.app_name:rest_framework.urls.app_name) 'auth/'>]

URL patterns for the Newsroom API.

newsroom.api.views module

API viewsets for the Newsroom application.

This module defines viewsets for articles and publishers with role-based permissions and custom actions.

  • ArticleViewSet – CRUD operations, approval workflow, and personalized article queries.

  • PublisherViewSet – Read-only access to publishers.

class newsroom.api.views.ArticleViewSet(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelViewSet

Viewset for managing Article instances.

Provides default CRUD actions along with custom actions for approving, listing personal articles, and listing subscribed articles. Enforces role-based permissions.

Parameters:

  • args (Any)

  • kwargs (Any)

Return type:

Any

queryset

Default queryset with related publisher and author preloaded.

Type:

QuerySet

serializer_class

Serializer used for articles.

Type:

ArticleSerializer

approve(request, pk=None)

Approve an article.

Changes status to APPROVED and sets approved_at timestamp if needed.

Returns:

JSON with status and approved_at timestamp.

Return type:

Response

get_permissions()[source]

Return appropriate permissions depending on the action.

  • list, retrieve, mine, subscribed → Authenticated users.

  • create, update, partial_update, destroy → Journalists only.

  • approve → Editors only.

get_queryset()[source]

Return a filtered queryset based on the user’s role.

  • Anonymous users: only approved articles.

  • Staff/superusers: all articles.

  • Editors: all articles.

  • Journalists: own articles + approved ones.

  • Readers: only approved articles.

mine(request)

List articles authored by the current journalist.

Only returns results for journalist users. Results are ordered by newest first.

perform_create(serializer)[source]

Create a new article authored by the current user.

Ensures only journalists (or staff/superusers) can create. New articles are saved with status PENDING.

Raises:

PermissionDenied – If the user is not allowed to create articles.

perform_destroy(instance)[source]

Delete an article with role-based restrictions.

  • Editors: can delete any article.

  • Journalists: can delete only their own articles.

  • Staff/superusers: unrestricted.

Raises:

PermissionDenied – If the user is not allowed to delete the article.

perform_update(serializer)[source]

Update an article with role-based restrictions.

  • Editors: can update any article.

  • Journalists: can update only their own articles.

  • Staff/superusers: unrestricted.

Raises:

PermissionDenied – If the user is not allowed to update the article.

queryset = <QuerySet [<Article: Rooftop Gardens Turn Old Warehouses Green (Approved)>, <Article: Pocket Drone Racing Gains a New Following (Approved)>, <Article: When AI Paints the Morning Coffee (Approved)>]>
serializer_class

alias of ArticleSerializer

subscribed(request)

List approved articles from a reader’s subscriptions.

Includes articles from: - Publishers the reader is subscribed to. - Journalists the reader is subscribed to.

Returns:

JSON list of approved subscribed articles.

Return type:

Response
